line.comment: * SCRIPT NAME: Run Globals Do Waits
* DESCRIPTION: Runs colouring script on ships in global arrays regularly on a timer.
* We colour ships upon creation using [SIGNAL_CHANGESECTOR] but our renaming is often overwritten by mod naming scripts.
* This is important for example for Pirate Guild 3 ships and Military Base Response Revamp ships.
* So we add the ships to global arrays and then run this script on a timer to check them when any mod renaming is probably done.
* We check lasertowers for a homebase to be recoloured. Lasertowers may die at similar time to the station they're guarding but the station doesn't trigger a signal when respawning.
* We check dockable ships for docked ships that will have not ever triggered a signal because they've never undocked.
* Script run on AL timer and at init so for each loops use random waits to smooth CPU usage. Otherwise identical to run.globals.nowaits.
* At 60FPS (unlikely) each frame takes 16.667ms so we set waits to take at least one frame.

line.text: 'Run Globals Do Waits - Lasertower Station Owned Ship'

sval.val: Run Globals Do Waits - Standard Ship
Run Globals Do Waits - Lasertower Station Owned Ship
Run Globals Do Waits - Command Ship
Run Globals Do Waits - Mob Boss
Run Globals Do Waits - Dockable Ship
Run Globals Do Waits - Docked Ship
SCRIPT NAME: Run Globals Do Waits
DESCRIPTION: Runs colouring script on ships in global arrays regularly on a timer.
We colour ships upon creation using [SIGNAL_CHANGESECTOR] but our renaming is often overwritten by mod naming scripts.
This is important for example for Pirate Guild 3 ships and Military Base Response Revamp ships.
So we add the ships to global arrays and then run this script on a timer to check them when any mod renaming is probably done.
We check lasertowers for a homebase to be recoloured. Lasertowers may die at similar time to the station they're guarding but the station doesn't trigger a signal when respawning.
We check dockable ships for docked ships that will have not ever triggered a signal because they've never undocked.
Script run on AL timer and at init so for each loops use random waits to smooth CPU usage. Otherwise identical to run.globals.nowaits.
At 60FPS (unlikely) each frame takes 16.667ms so we set waits to take at least one frame.
